meanings.definition: The tall, perennial grasses with thick stems that are used to produce sugar.
meanings.sent1: Farmers grow sugarcane to make sugarcanes.
meanings.sent2: The field was filled with tall sugarcanes swaying in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey swung from the sugarcanes, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The sugarcanes stood like soldiers in rows, ready to be harvested.
meanings.sent5: The sweet smell of sugarcanes filled the air as we walked through the plantation.

meanings.definition: The sweet juice extracted from sugarcane plants.
meanings.sent1: Freshly squeezed sugarcanes are a popular drink in many tropical regions.
meanings.sent2: The vendor sold glasses of cold sugarcanes to thirsty customers.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they tried to drink the sticky sugarcanes without spilling.
meanings.sent4: The sweet melody of the sugarcanes being juiced filled the market square.
meanings.sent5: Her lips puckered at the tangy taste of the sugarcanes she had just sipped.

meanings.definition: The fibrous residue left after extracting juice from sugarcane plants.
meanings.sent1: After juicing the sugarcanes, the leftover bagasse was used as animal feed.
meanings.sent2: The bagasse from the sugarcanes was recycled to make eco-friendly products.
meanings.sent3: The bagasse piled up high, resembling a mountain of sugarcanes.
meanings.sent4: The bagasse crackled in the fire, releasing a sweet aroma of sugarcanes.
meanings.sent5: The bagasse was soft to touch, like a blanket made of sugarcanes fibers.
